Definition: You are given an app review. Your task is to output "Positive" if the sentiment of the review is positive, or "Negative" if the sentiment of the review is negative.

Positive Examples.input: Fantastic app! When I connect my BT headset  I have it set to read important notifications - add that to Google Now's                 ability to create texts  reminders and calendar events  and my $20 headset has all the functionality of a smartwatch.                     Kudos to the developer!
Positive Examples.explanation: There is an expression of happiness in this text. Hence, it is Positive

Positive Examples.input: Sucks On Honor 6  does not work.
Positive Examples.explanation: There is an expression of sadness and anger in this text. Hence, it is Negative

Negative Examples.input: Does nothing Worthless app does nothing
Negative Examples.explanation: There is an expression of sadness in this text but it is labeled as Positive. It should be Negative

Negative Examples.input: Great application Work's well with my ZenFone 5
Negative Examples.explanation: There is an expression of happiness in this text but it is labeled as Negative. It should be Positive

Instances.input: Doesn't work on S4 Doesn't work on S4

Modifies web browser Immediately after installing this I found my web pages in Dolphin (default browser) covered with those annoying double underlined spam links. Immediately after removing the app the links went away. I don't mind in app advertising or splash screens but don't hijack my browser!
Does not show change current Does not function as stated. Galaxy Note Edge
Amazing Love the added demos now. Using mine with hackrf. Also tested with RTL. Both work perfectly! Thanks for a great implementation.
Brilliant Work If u could add in regular expressions too then power users can change what is said to remove unnecessary text etc
Not user-friendly Can't see information it's meant to show
Love it Even you have a later version of android  it can read notification
